intro: Oxytropis sverdrupii, commonly known as Sverdrup's locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the western United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are compound, consisting of multiple oval-shaped leaflets, and it often grows in dry, sandy soils. Oxytropis sverdrupii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
